instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.BLK_EN: What is BLK_EN? This is a typo of BKL_EN When you see BLK_EN, assume they meant to type BKL_EN.
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.

threads.title: 00165 no backlight
threads.message: was liquid damaged around lcd side. sent through ultrasonic clearer. replaced the fpc, backlight ic and filter. powered on and it blew the filter. Where should i start to find out the short? i checked the caps and none seem to be short.

threads.title: 00165 no backlight
threads.message: okay fuse broke again and it cracked <CAPACITOR>C7799</CAPACITOR>. replaced them both and now have a stable 8.49v going to backlight.  is the backlight ic bad again?

threads.title: 00165 no backlight
threads.message:
Never power up a board before checking for short, or any reason of the burnt component found there!!!

Check traces between <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> and L/<DIODE>D7701</DIODE>.
Pay atention to FB connection.
Many times gets bad solder under <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>; also XW7720 get corroded (near L7701)...
Post voltages around <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>.

threads.title: 00165 no backlight
threads.message: Inspect <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> for corrosion and a missing A5 ball. Post a high quality picture of the area near the BL diode.

threads.title: 00165 no backlight
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 40838"]Never power up a board before checking for short, or any reason of the burnt component found there!!![/QUOTE]

I know, if you check my first post there was no short.  when i put power it busted the fuse and cracked the cap.  that created the short.

threads.title: 00165 no backlight
threads.message:
Did you check all continuity mentioned above?
Be sure no broken/corroded trace and check the 6 return resistors too.
PRAM done?
Other LCD assembly tested?

threads.title: 00165 no backlight
threads.message:
No Title

okay found the missing testpoint!

my question is on board view there shows xw7720...but on the board there is no such part!  where do i run the wires for this testpoint???????

threads.title: 00165 no backlight
threads.message:
Is just a trace bridge, between L7701 and <DIODE>D7701</DIODE>...
Louis has a video about how to recover it, using two test point from the other side to FB pad of <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>.
First clean the area between L/<DIODE>D7701</DIODE> and see if possible to recover the bridge right there.

threads.title: 00165 no backlight
threads.message:
if its a trace bridge between those two why do i still have continuity between those two points?

spent a couple min looking for that video and couldnt find it.  have any idea where it is?

threads.title: 00165 no backlight
threads.message:
You must check continuity to the other side.
The trace from XW7720 go inside the board.
In fact there is no direct bridge with a hole; part of the trace is wired on internal layer until FB pad.

threads.title: 00165 no backlight
threads.message:
yes but where? there is no test point on the other side that matches with the board view! Im so very confused. Where is XW7720 on the board?

I understand that a trace is missing and needs to be fixed.  All im asking for is a little help on where i need to be running the trace since boardview isn't helping!

threads.title: 00165 no backlight
threads.message: Remove <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> and see if the A5 ball has continuity to <DIODE>D7701</DIODE>....same for the LCD BKLT BOOST pins

threads.title: 00165 no backlight
threads.message:
A5 ball has a bit of pad which can be used for test.
Be sure that pad has no corrosion; sometime doesn't make contact with the A5 ball right there.

"Louis has a video about how to recover it, using two test point from the other side to FB pad of [URL="https://store.rossmanngroup.com/b1-<CHIP>LP8550</CHIP>.html"]<CHIP>U7701</CHIP>[/URL]."
Why don't search in the Louis channel?

threads.title: 00165 no backlight
threads.message: removed <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> and tested a5 and both LCD BKLT BOOST and has continuity to <DIODE>D7701</DIODE>

threads.title: 00165 no backlight
threads.message: Solder new chip, probably was just a bad contact of FB pad...

threads.title: 00165 no backlight
threads.message: Replaced the <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> again. Looks like it caused all this heartache. Probably it sent to much voltage and busted the fuse and cracked the cap. Dunno why i had such trouble with this. Backlights are usually pretty easy to fix.

threads.title: 00165 no backlight
threads.message:
FB solder fail a lot, don't be surprised.
The internal switch of boost converter from <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> is connected there...
